result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark W. Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark W. Perez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark W. Perez was found guilty of Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.
  • Mark W. Perez was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Mark W. Perez was found guilty of Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Veronica Lopez, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Maintain a stable residence.

records.addlTxt: Amended
Amended Clerk's Certificate - 2017AP317-CR
COA Motion for Extension of Time for Attorney to File No Merit Report filed by Atty Len Kachinsky

Dated 4/19/17 - IT IS ORDERED that Attorney Kachinsky's motion to withdraw as appointed counsel is denied.  He shall continue as appointed counsel in this case.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the hold on further proceedings in this appeal ordered on March 7, 2017, is hereby lifted.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the time to file a statement on transcript is extended to May 1, 2017.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the time under WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30(2)(k) is extended and the record shall be transmitted within twenty days after the filing of the transcript designated in the statement on transcript or within twenty days after the filing of a statement on transcript indicating that no transcript is necessary for prosecution of the appeal.

IT IS ORDERED that no later than April 4, 2017, Mark W. Perez shall file the response required by this ordered; IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Kchinsky's motion to withdraw is held in abeyance until further order of this court; IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this appeal is stayed pending further order of this court

State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments are made.  Statement given by DE's mother in court.  
Counts 2, 5 and 7  DE is sentenced to 5 years in the WSP consecutive to any other sentence but concurrent to each other.  2 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years Extended Supervision.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  No contact with Veronica L. unless permitted by the court only.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant appears by video conference from Stanley Correctional and with Attorney Hilary Edwards who appears in court.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and DE waives his right to appear in person.  Case is resolved.  Counts 2, 5 and 7 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 1, 3, 4, 6 and 8 -  Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 7/16/15 at 10:30 AM.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody appearing by Video Conf. from Stanley Corr. and with Attorney Hilary Edwards who is present in court.  Clerk: PT
Arguments heard on State's motion to reinstate Count 5, which was dismissed by Comm. Berman at the arraignment.  Upon hearing arguments court grants motion and Count 5 is reinstated.  Atty Edwards waives the reading as to Count 5 and enters Not Guilty plea in Count 5.  Atty Edwards requests DE be permitted to appear by video conf. for the upcoming jury status on 5/28/15 for purposes of a possible plea.
